programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The special victims squad tries to take down a sex-trafficking operation that enslaves young women; when the investigation is halted by Lt. Alexandra Eames (Kathryn Erbe), Detective Benson has to get creative.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The kidnapping of a young boy reminds Cragen, Munch and Benson of an unsolved case from 13 years earlier.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The investigation into a girl's disappearance leads to a high-tech kidnapper who uses the Internet to cover his tracks; Rollins reconnects with her sister.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a woman claims that the baby she kidnapped is hers with a respected legal expert, the investigation changes the lives of two families.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: As the detectives investigate reports of sexual abuse at an elite private school, decades of secrets are exposed.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A man goes on a killing spree, but he has links to a prostitute that Benson encountered in an earlier investigation, so the FBI contacts SVU for information.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Holiday celebrations are interrupted when Detective Tutuola's ex-brother-in-law is arrested for attacking a priest; during the investigation, a church scandal is uncovered.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a rape victim is arrested for murder in Suffolk County, Detective Benson questions the case and finds enough evidence for District Attorney Barba to charge a different suspect in Manhattan.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives go under cover to arrest a man who brutally attacks other men; a deceptively tough defense attorney (Nia Vardalos) complicates ADA Barba's case.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a janitor violently attacks a coach, the SVU team connects the janitor's behavior to a history of sexual abuse; the detectives find more victims of the same predator -- including a prisoner (Mike Tyson) on death row.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: FBI Agent Dana Lewis partners with SVU when she thinks a 25-year-old rape-murder case in New York is connected to multiple unsolved cases across the country; as Lewis doggedly pursues her suspect, Benson and Amaro question his guilt.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU squad tries to keep Detective Rollins' sister safe from her abusive boyfriend when she turns up beaten and pregnant; when Rollins is forced to take drastic action, an internal affairs investigation begins.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby and Michelle team up with a con artist to catch a human trafficker.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: An actor is murdered while filming an alleged cursed horror movie.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: The police superintendent interferes with the capture of a murder suspect.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth and the lab team desperately search for Brennan after she's kidnapped by her former assistant, Zack Addy.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates whether an artificial intelligence bot was programmed to kill its creator; Bones plans a surprise for her birthday.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team becomes enmeshed in retirement home drama when the body of an old man is found in an acid dump site; back at the lab, discussion of marriage and kids dominates the conversation.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a person from Booth and Brennan's past; Aubrey learns his dad is back in the picture.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a tutor who works with privileged students turns up dead, the team sifts through possible murderers; Bones wants to voice her own audiobook.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a businessman with a history of harassment claims against him is killed, the team suspects the killer may be one of his many accusers.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: A bank holdup leads the team to a safe deposit box, the contents of which have the potential to destroy national security; Kristen is eager to get back into field work while other team members still have their concerns.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The son of a retired FBI agent is kidnapped, and the team must investigate if it's an act of revenge; Isobel must make a hard call when information from the past comes to light.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When an attorney is found dead near the body of a private escort, the team must piece together what connected the two seemingly random victims; Jubal's connection with one of the victims makes finding the killer much more personal.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a truck filled with armor-piercing rifles is hijacked, the team works to discover who stole it, and what they have planned for the stolen weapons; a friend from OA's past returns to help with the case, but OA isn't sure he can trust him.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After the police ignore a desperate father's plea for help, he abducts a billionaire's daughter and holds her hostage in a safe room until his own missing child is returned to him; Jubal puts his hostage negotiation skills to the test.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When the team is called to the scene of a murder, it quickly suspects political motivation; Maggie contemplates a decision that could affect her entire career.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Jess LaCroix and his team come to help OA find a fugitive LaCroix arrested years ago after a bus with 26 students goes missing and he's the main suspect.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A Perfect Storm chronicles how a major blizzard created an audience for the first-ever live broadcast of the Daytona 500 and television's big gamble on the sport.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Three of NASCAR’s Rising stars are thrown into the fire as they take on the most famous and dangerous track in America - Daytona to kick off the season. Go deep inside the lives of Rajah Caruth, Jesse Love, and Carson Hocevar as they prepare for the biggest race of the season. Who will triumph and who will crash and burn?

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After his disastrous day at Daytona, Carson Hocevar changes his tune and dazzles the NASCAR world with his aggression in Atlanta. Learn more about where Rajah Caruth comes from as well as his philosophy on the peaks and valleys of a NASCAR season. Jesse Love prepares for his NASCAR cup debut on the golf course with fellow driver Connor Zilisch.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Relive three of the most impactful weeks in Carson Hocevar’s life, where he had a shot to win three races in a row.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After a dreary start to the season, Rajah Caruth claims his second career win in Nashville. Jesse Love relives the most challenging years of his life before returning to his home track in Sonoma. Amidst the August heat in Daytona Beach, Carson Hocevar has one last shot to prove he’s a playoff driver.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: A full recap of the playoff run of both Rajah Caruth and Jesse Love - which results in a spectacularly dramatic race in Phoenix.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh must bring a man back for murder. He has to outwit men bent on claiming the bounty.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Barry Brewer: Chicago, I'm Home
programme.desc: With over 15 years as a stand-up, Barry Brewer has a lot to say to his sold out crowd at the Studebaker Theater, where he recounts his life.

programme.desc: Comedy Central roast veteran Whitney Cummings gets the stage to herself in this debut special, which finds the young comedian riffing on a wide range of topics, chiefly the differences between men and women and how both behave in relationships.

programme.title: Tammy Pescatelli: Finding the Funny
programme.desc: The hilarious and sometimes humiliating aspects of domestic life, including marriage and in-laws, are the focus of this comedy special.

programme.title: Pablo Francisco: Ouch! Live From San Jose!

programme.title: Keep Your Distance
programme.desc: Tony Baker; Ryan Davis; Jay "Big Irish" Hollingsworth; CP; Precious Hall; T. Murph.

programme.title: Dov Davidoff: Lower Your Expectations
programme.desc: Performing in Chicago, the brash stand-up comedian discusses the nonsensical truths in our culture, and wonders what America is becoming.

programme.title: Matt Besser: Besser Breaks the Record
programme.desc: Matt Besser is here to air some grievances and break some comedy records, just don't bring up weed and he'll stay on track. With a new set of commandments, a collection of letters to the editor and his nemesis Ivan Krushnev Jr. making an appearance, this special is like no other! Filmed live at the UCB theater in Hollywood.

programme.title: Samantha Hale: Only Happy When It's Raining Men
programme.desc: Comedian-artist Samantha Hale, granddaughter of “Gilligan’s Island’s Alan Hale, the Skipper, shares her life and losses in her stand-up comedy show.

programme.title: Michael Gelbart: All New Smash Hits
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Michael Gelbart's profanity-free, yet adult set, for audiences takes on love, relationships, and where the world is now.

programme.title: Kendra Cunningham: On My Best Behavior
programme.desc: Comedian Kendra Cunningham is here with her stand up set where topics range from doctor co-pays to why outgrowing your underwear is devastating.

programme.title: Jay Pharoah: Can I Be Me?
programme.desc: Saturday Night Live cast member Jay Pharoah trots out his greatest celebrity impressions, from Chris Rock to Kanye West to Barack Obama and many more.

programme.title: Jeff Garcia
programme.desc: Jeff Garcia aims to give audiences their money's worth with his signature original shows in this 2008 special.

programme.title: Jeff Garcia: Low Budget Madness
programme.desc: Shot live at San Manuel Indian Bingo and Casino in Highland, CA, Jeff Garcia's Low Budget Madness is packed with hilarious sketches that will leave you in stitches and remind you why audiences all over the world can't get a enough of Jeff Garcia!

programme.title: Jeff Garcia: Living the Dream
programme.desc: The Latino comedian and voiceover artist brings his signature style to jokes about family, cars, white people, marriage, and his run-ins with the law.

programme.title: Sklar Brothers: Hipster Ghosts
programme.desc: Performing in Chicago, the Sklar Brothers tackle topics such as politics, parenting, canine racism, and who might haunt us in the afterlife.

programme.title: Brian Gaar: Jokes I Wrote at Work
programme.desc: In his first hour-long comedy special, Twitter sensation Brian Gaar tackles everything from the challenges of fatherhood to trying to keep his gamer cred in his 30s. Filmed live at the Spider House Ballroom in Austin, Texas.

programme.title: Dana Gould: I Know It’s Wrong
programme.desc: Dana Gould takes on the absurdities of modern life through a pop-culture obsessed lens. Unapologetic and off-the-wall funny, there's no middle ground in this comedy special filmed at the Neptune Theater in Seattle, WA.

programme.title: Drew Allen: Out of Ideas
programme.desc: The extremely analytical stand up comedian discusses buying shorts, having low self-esteem, and other anxious musings on the modern world.

programme.title: Ilana Glazer: The Planet Is Burning
programme.desc: “Broad City” star Ilana Glazer steps up in her first standup comedy set, done in her own raucous style as she takes on Nazis, diva cups, and stoners.

programme.title: Chad Daniels: As Is
programme.desc: Recorded live at the Acme Comedy Co. in Minneapolis Chad Daniels tackles such topics as airline travel, his kids and puberty. Uncut & uncensored!

programme.title: Jeff Allen: I Can Laugh About It Now
programme.desc: The comedian discusses his life’s difficulties including addiction, bankruptcy, and how to overcome tragedy by making lemonade out of lemons.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: Honor Thy Wife
programme.desc: The laugh-out-loud funny stand up comedian focuses his special on the hilarious highs and relatable lows of everyday married life.

programme.title: Jesus Trejo: Stay at Home Son

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Hellcats" (1969) Crime drama. A slain policeman's brother and girlfriend infiltrate a motorcycle gang of drug smugglers. With Ross Hagen, Dee Duffy, Sharyn Kinzie.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Project Moonbase" (1953) Science fiction. The president is a woman and so is the captain of a lunar space station in the year 1970. With Donna Martell, Hayden Rorke, Ross Ford.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "High School Big Shot" (1959) Crime drama. An academic achiever falls for a girl who leads him astray; with Tom Pittman.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The police consult a metaphysicist to help solve a case; onboard the Satellite of Love, Mike and the Bots impersonate the Grateful Dead and Gypsy runs the crew through a fire drill.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Horror of Party Beach" (1964) Horror. Rockin' gilled monsters crash a beach bash; with John Scott; Alice Lyon.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Jonah and the 'bots endure Munchie, where a kid finds a creature who tries to help him but just gets him in more trouble.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A botched experiment hurls scientists into a bleak future full of mutants, androids and catty humans.

programme.title: Backlot
programme.desc: Check out the interesting career of Robert Lippert, the Hollywood producer known for cranking out budget cinema.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: After plunging the frazzled crew into a world of prophecies, gnarly spiders and scantily clad warriors, Kinga unveils her next diabolical plan.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Jonah and crew dig into a schlocky ski-resort disaster flick starring Rock Hudson and Mia Farrow.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: In Tormented, jazz pianist Tom Stewart, soon to marry the woman he loves, watches former love Vi Mason fall from a lighthouse and does not save her. Vi’s spirit returns and begins to torment Tom at his every step.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Earth vs. the Spider" (1958) Science fiction. Teens and a teacher hunt a spider enlarged by an atomic-bomb test. With Ed Kemmer, June Kenney, Gene Persson.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "War of the Colossal Beast" (1958) Cult. Man-beast escapes in "Amazing Colossal Man" sequel.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Magic Sword" (1962) Children. Knight St. George rescues a princess from a sorcerer and his two-headed dragon. With Basil Rathbone, Estelle Winwood, Gary Lockwood.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Amanda Reese breaks out in hives and begins to hyperventilate after returning from a Hurricane Katrina relief effort. Dr. G wonders if an infection caused this young woman's untimely death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A diabetic man dies after a night out. Meanwhile, an elderly man's decomposing body is found in his son's home. Dr. G realizes that finding the causes of death will be anything but straight-forward.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 94-year-old woman dies in the hospital after having a convulsion. The case becomes the business of the medical examiner's office when no one will sign her death certificate.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired military officer is found dead in his own backyard during a freak ice storm in San Antonio, Texas.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train passenger behaves oddly en route to Arizona and then disappears. The next day his bloodied body is found in Texas. Dr. G attempts to piece together this bizarre tragedy.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police are driving down the street when a man suddenly jumps in front of their car. They screech to a halt and avoid hitting him, but the man is highly agitated.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When the husband, Tao Chen, is shot to death by his wife Jun, she claims she pulled the trigger in self-defense when a drunken Tao came after her with a gun.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police patrolling the night streets hear gunshots and head to the scene. They find a nude middle-aged man in parking lot lying face down in a puddle of blood.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's a late night and a Vietnam veteran with a history of mental illness is drunk and stumbling through an apartment complex. When the police arrive, he pulls a gun and shoots himself in the head.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A cabdriver develops chest pains and seizures; a hotel manager is found dead on the steps of his apartment.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After a brief illness, 34-year old Claire Jackson dies suddenly in the hospital from massive liver failure and winds up in Dr. G's morgue.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Melissa Riobe's life is ruled by her addiction to drugs. Now, the 42-year-old woman has learned how to buy powerful prescription drugs online without a doctor's note.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An infant and his two-year-old sister are found dead in a house shared by two families. At first, they are believed to have died from either carbon monoxide poisoning or cold medicine overdoses.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasn't woken up. By the time help arrives, it's too late. But there is no apparent cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: During her career as a medical examiner, Dr. G has autopsied thousands of murder victims. In this episode, Dr. G shares her most memorable case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It is 3am and Deputy Torres is cruising a Texas highway when he suddenly spots a crushed pick-up truck along the side of the road. Trapped inside is the lifeless body of 24-year-old Luis Reyes.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An employee is found dead in a restaurant kitchen. Clues found near the body include an empty cash register, a knife and a trail of blood splotches leading to a vandalized car in the parking lot.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A decomposing body is found in a pond and a tent is found nearby. Dr. G performs the autopsy in the morgue but finds few clues other than fingerprints and mouthwash in the stomach.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: While in the process of adopting a five-week-old baby, a mother takes him to work with her. While there, the baby inexplicably obtains a skull fracture while unsupervised.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired businessman travels from England to Florida to visit his family but dies soon after arriving. Dr. G must now determine what mysteriously killed this healthy man so suddenly.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G. has just graduated from medical school and is set to begin her first job as an M.E. in Jacksonville, Florida when a high-profile case challenges her to use her newly acquired skills.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Carol Moleskie agrees to go on a hunting excursion with her husband, Bob. A few hours after they enter the woods, they emerge again, Bob frantically waving down traffic as he carries his bloody wife.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Manny Alvarez mysteriously crashes his car into a fence. He dies en route to the hospital, leaving behind a wife and son. It is up to Dr. G to find out what cut this young man's life short.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A doctor with a severe bee allergy is stung while treating a critical patient who's been stabbed in the eye; a man comes into the ER after slitting his own throat; a paramedic becomes a patient when she's struck by a mysterious illness.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER physician races to determine why a young woman is burning up from the inside out after a beach visit.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young girl, recently hit by a hockey puck, is now mysteriously paralyzed from the waist down.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient appears to be hallucinating and sends the ER staff on a wild-goose chase around the hospital.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A surgeon requires urgent treatment after falling off a bed while trying to help his patient.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: When a man with a hand injury passes out from abdominal pain, tests lead to a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Celebrations morph into medical mania after their special occasions land them in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man itching from poison oak exposure turns out to also have maggots burrowing into an injury on his back.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young woman is rushed to the ER after being bitten on the face by a dog.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A violent patient faking a coma holds doctors and police hostage after stealing a policeman's gun.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Celebrations morph into medical mania after their special occasions land them in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A live boa constrictor wrapped around a man's arm is biting his wrist and won't let go.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man itching from poison oak exposure turns out to also have maggots burrowing into an injury on his back.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: From extraordinary challenges to outrageous predicaments, nurses tell true medical stories from their unique perspectives.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man has a sword impaled in his head in a roleplaying battle, a patient is terrified of germs and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's leg pain turns out to be flesh-eating virus, threatening life and limb; a Desert Storm war veteran swallows razor blades on a dare; a bride-to-be spends her wedding day in the ER after collapsing at the altar.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman who inhaled toxic fumes now believes her neighbors want to kill her.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two seemingly unrelated gunshot wounds lead to a bizarre night in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A Halloween zombie with a problem below the belt mystifies doctors.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: The hospital is locked down when a nurse is shot in the ER. A bride is rushed in from her wedding.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A first hand look at individuals who didn't expect to become human shish kabobs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is impaled in the abdomen by a stiletto heel. A seemingly healthy outdoorsman has a series of seizures.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A circus sword-swallower suffers from a persistent case of hiccups; a mother and daughter mysteriously collapse in the ER; a woman loses control of her legs at her daughter's graduation.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient appears to be hallucinating and sends the ER staff on a wild-goose chase around the hospital.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A policewoman has been shot by a carjacker, two middle-aged men have severe burns and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A skier clings to life after slamming into a tree at 50mph.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A circus performer is bitten by a poisonous snake, a baby is delivered in a car park and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A 21-year-old man has suffered internal injuries in a motorcycle accident.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Dr. Castillo thought he had seen it all until the day a seven-foot man comes in blind drunk and unconscious.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A jewelry shop owner is shot point blank in the chest during a robbery.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A policeman is struck by a speeding driver seeking revenge, which may leave him with no legs.

Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost shares the progress that's been made in his garden. Frances Tophill heads to the beach to reveal what gardeners can learn from the coastal plants which have evolved to cope with more extreme conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants mahonia for winter colour and scent, demonstrates how to take salvia cuttings and introduces a special addition to Longmeadow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts work on revamping the writing garden, plants crocus bulbs and harvests pumpkins. Frances Tophill visits a unique plant conservation centre responsible for preserving key historical plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens

programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross creates a spectacular warm winter painting where snow-covered mountains, trees and bushes lend an alluring sense of beauty in an oval.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Travel down an abandoned road with Bob Ross and stumble upon an old weathered barn that has seen better days - what dreams are made of.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Colors transforming, cool breezes and rushing waters - Bob Ross lets his paint brushes do all the talking in the magnificent mountain scene.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Happen upon this sweet cabin in the woods; Bob Ross paints a time-forgotten treasure that comes to life in a soft, warm landscape scene.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross presents a really unique idea using black gesso -- two lovely paintings in one -- summer and winter scenes overlapping on the same canvas!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Warb and Nick with The Hunting Public, have two days to hunt Missouri public land at the end of October. After nonstop encounters and wild rut activity, Halloween delivers the chance they’ve been waiting for.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a family filled episode as Brandon Simmons goes offshore with his Cousin to find Cobia and Tuna while also bringing his family to his childhood home

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon gets back to his roots and explores the waterways around Cape Canaveral in his Pelican Kayak with his old Fishing buddy, Tyler Hendrix

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: WWII Veteran Don Halverson served in the 34th Red Bull Division. He fought in some of WWII's most historic battles; including Mount Pantano and Monte Cassino.
Shan Twit, the newest member of Team200, chases some big whitetails in his home state of Kentucky!

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Ryan Onufreychuk is on a run taking 3 mega giants the past three seasons and this season he is looking to add a buck called "Super 8" to that streak.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: After starting turkey season off on the road, it's time for us to come back home to Pennsylvania and hunt some turkeys on our home turf! Also joining us this week are our good friends from The Grind Outdoors who come in to hunt some long beards with us.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Si Robertson and Justin Martin from @DuckCommanderOfficial hunt with Lee Ellis and Kendell Golightly with @seekone8708 during the @realtree Max-7 pro staff Hunt in Louisiana. Lee, on his first duck hunt, is hoping to learn quickly and become the official goose guy of the outdoors while Uncle Si tries not to shoot the decoys!?!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hunts his farm in Georgia and tags out on a beautiful 10 pointer using the Franchi .308.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: After a successful opening weekend, the crew heads out to work on controlling the doe population only to have an encounter with a huge 8-pointer. Should Bryan Brown have shot?

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt sits down with Auburn University professor Dr. Steve Ditchkoff to tackle one of the most debated topics in deer management: cull bucks. Is there real science behind the idea of removing “inferior” bucks to improve herd genetics, or is it more myth than management?

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It is Mark Peterson’s third day in Mexico hunting for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. After bagging two big bucks in just two days with his new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, he is now moving to a new farm where a giant 12-point buck has often been seen in the southeast corner of the property. It’s the coldest day since he arrived, which typically means the deer will be more active. He is thrilled at the prospect of what could be the best day yet. If everything goes well, they will spend the evening hunting hogs from the high rack.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this weeks episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade and his daughter Asa take on the turkey woods together for the first time. As this is Asa's first time turkey hunting some quick pre hunt preparations are in order. Slade also was able to sit down with a good friend and registered forester to talk fire and the benefits of fire in land management. The next day, Asa and Slade were able to connect with a thundering tom as Asa punched her first ever turkey tag!

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: On this episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade does more summer food plot prep in hopes "Pope" will make an appearance! With Rain on the way Slade is able to disk and seed his "Pope" Summer spot!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will take you to some of the wrecks in the Florida Keys that locals love to dive and share their rich history and the stories held deep aboard these sunken ships. We will also take a deep dive and discuss how these wrecks are critical to the environment.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will follow people rethinking how they can make a difference by volunteering to help the environment in the Florida Keys. Whether you are traveling to the Keys on vacation or you live there, people are making a difference by giving back.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Warb and Nick with The Hunting Public, have two days to hunt Missouri public land at the end of October. After nonstop encounters and wild rut activity, Halloween delivers the chance they’ve been waiting for.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a family filled episode as Brandon Simmons goes offshore with his Cousin to find Cobia and Tuna while also bringing his family to his childhood home

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon gets back to his roots and explores the waterways around Cape Canaveral in his Pelican Kayak with his old Fishing buddy, Tyler Hendrix

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: WWII Veteran Don Halverson served in the 34th Red Bull Division. He fought in some of WWII's most historic battles; including Mount Pantano and Monte Cassino.
Shan Twit, the newest member of Team200, chases some big whitetails in his home state of Kentucky!

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Ryan Onufreychuk is on a run taking 3 mega giants the past three seasons and this season he is looking to add a buck called "Super 8" to that streak.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: After starting turkey season off on the road, it's time for us to come back home to Pennsylvania and hunt some turkeys on our home turf! Also joining us this week are our good friends from The Grind Outdoors who come in to hunt some long beards with us.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Si Robertson and Justin Martin from @DuckCommanderOfficial hunt with Lee Ellis and Kendell Golightly with @seekone8708 during the @realtree Max-7 pro staff Hunt in Louisiana. Lee, on his first duck hunt, is hoping to learn quickly and become the official goose guy of the outdoors while Uncle Si tries not to shoot the decoys!?!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hunts his farm in Georgia and tags out on a beautiful 10 pointer using the Franchi .308.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: After a successful opening weekend, the crew heads out to work on controlling the doe population only to have an encounter with a huge 8-pointer. Should Bryan Brown have shot?

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt sits down with Auburn University professor Dr. Steve Ditchkoff to tackle one of the most debated topics in deer management: cull bucks. Is there real science behind the idea of removing “inferior” bucks to improve herd genetics, or is it more myth than management?

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It is Mark Peterson’s third day in Mexico hunting for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. After bagging two big bucks in just two days with his new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, he is now moving to a new farm where a giant 12-point buck has often been seen in the southeast corner of the property. It’s the coldest day since he arrived, which typically means the deer will be more active. He is thrilled at the prospect of what could be the best day yet. If everything goes well, they will spend the evening hunting hogs from the high rack.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this weeks episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade and his daughter Asa take on the turkey woods together for the first time. As this is Asa's first time turkey hunting some quick pre hunt preparations are in order. Slade also was able to sit down with a good friend and registered forester to talk fire and the benefits of fire in land management. The next day, Asa and Slade were able to connect with a thundering tom as Asa punched her first ever turkey tag!

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: On this episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade does more summer food plot prep in hopes "Pope" will make an appearance! With Rain on the way Slade is able to disk and seed his "Pope" Summer spot!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Conspiracy Theory
programme.desc: A taxi driver reveals his conspiracy theories to the justice department.

programme.title: Club Paradise
programme.desc: A Chicago fireman holds onto his dream of owning a tropical island resort.

programme.title: Cannonball Run II
programme.desc: The usual suspects return for a new breakneck, ocean-to-ocean free for all!

programme.title: Lake Placid vs. Anaconda
programme.desc: Get ready for a non-stop bloodbath, unlike anything you've ever seen before in this heart-pounding battle between mutated crocodiles and anacondas.

programme.title: Lake Placid 2
programme.desc: As fierce giant male crocs and a feisty female guarding her eggs return to the lake, the sheriff, a big-game hunter, and a wildlife officer step up.

programme.title: Lake Placid
programme.desc: At a serene Maine lake, a 30-foot reptilian eating machine hungers for a fragile paleontologist on her first field assignment and a tasty billionaire.

programme.title: The Cave
programme.desc: Trapped inside an underwater network of caverns under the Carpathian Mountains, a diving exploration team becomes bait for bloodthirsty monsters.

programme.title: The Nines
programme.desc: A troubled actor, a television show runner, and an acclaimed video game designer find their lives intertwining in mysterious and unsettling ways.

programme.title: The China Syndrome
programme.desc: A news reporter (Jane Fonda) and her cameraman (Michael Douglas) are unintentional witnesses to a SCRAM incident, an emergency core shutdown procedure at a nuclear power plant in California. The crew prevents a catastrophe, but the plant supervisor (Jack Lemmon) begins to suspect the plant is in violation of safety standards, and tries desperately to bring it to the attention of the public, fearing that another SCRAM incident will produce an atomic disaster.

programme.title: Murphy's Romance
programme.desc: After moving to small-town Arizona and falling for an older widowed pharmacist, a divorcée with a 12-year old son gets an unwanted visit from her ex.

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
programme.desc: An unhappy woman named Peggy Sue tries to change her future when she inadvertently travels back in time to her senior year of high school.

programme.title: Places in the Heart
programme.desc: This stirring drama follows a widow as she struggles to raise her two children and save her Texas farm during the Great Depression.

programme.title: Postcards From the Edge
programme.desc: A very real mother-daughter relationship and rivalry set against the backdrop of late 1980’s Hollywood. Based on Carrie Fisher's best-selling novel.

programme.title: Sunset
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and James Garner star as 1920s legends, actor Tom Mix and crimefighter Wyatt Earp, who join forces to solve a Beverly Hills killing.

programme.title: Blue Thunder
programme.desc: Classic ‘80s action film about a police pilot who learns that the futuristic helicopter he’s testing could cause hellish destruction on U.S. citizens.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A vacationing couple gets embroiled in a game of cat-and-mouse with Bermuda gangsters after discovering a cache of drugs stashed inside a sunken ship.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acuña (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: Theodora Goes Wild
programme.desc: Theodora Lynn (Irene Dunne) is secretly the author of a salacious novel written under a pen name. She must hide her identity from the residents of her small, conservative Connecticut town, who disapprove of the book. When Theodora goes to New York to visit her publisher (Thurston Hall), she meets the book's cover artist, Michael Grant (Melvyn Douglas), who tries to convince her to reveal herself as the real author. When Theodora falls for Michael, she soon finds that he has secrets of his own.

programme.title: Jeanne Eagels
programme.desc: A look into the life of the celebrated Broadway actress who in 1922 made her name playing Sadie Thompson in Somerset Maugham's "Rain."

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: The heroic mariner must clear all sorts of hurdles in the way of rescuing a princess who’s been miniaturized and held captive by a ruthless magician.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: In England during World War II, a pair of bomber pilots fall for the same woman but only one will make it through the conflict to ask for her hand.

programme.title: The Game That Kills
programme.desc: A man infiltrates a hockey team to investigate the death of his brother, the team's star left wing.

programme.title: All Ashore
programme.desc: When they finally get some shore leave, three sailors head to Catalina Island and try to meet girls while pretending to be entertainers.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: Bad for Each Other
programme.desc: Wooed by a Pittsburgh socialite, an idealistic doctor from a mining town is torn between helping his community and lucrative work at an elite clinic.

programme.title: Bell, Book and Candle
programme.desc: A Greenwich Village witch falls for her dashing neighbor. When she learns he’s engaged, she casts a love spell but risks losing her powers for good.

programme.title: Bye Bye Birdie
programme.desc: When the draft selects rock star Conrad Birdie, his fans are devastated, but none more than struggling songwriter Albert Peterson (Dick Van Dyke), whose song Birdie was just about to record. Albert's longtime girlfriend, Rosie (Janet Leigh), pushes Albert to write a new tune that Birdie will perform on television to a fan selected in a contest. The scheme works, with young Ohio teenager Kim McAfee (Ann-Margret) declared the winner, but no one has counted on the jealous wrath of her boyfriend.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: The conniving Ed Barker (Dick Curtis) murders a rancher and tries to steal the ranch from his widow, Jean Andrews (Ann Doran). However, their old friend Cliff Houston (Charles Starrett) appears on the scene to try and save the day. He makes a deal with Barker and his crew to drive the Andrews herd to market and split the money, but each man really plans to con the other as soon as the time is right. Along for the ride is singing cowboy Bob Stevens (Bob Nolan).

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain
programme.desc: A stubborn rancher in his twilight years takes on the U.S. government when the Air Force tries to expropriate his New Mexico land for a missile range.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: The Blazing Trail
programme.desc: A worthless gold mine leads the Durango Kid and a newspaperman on a trail marked by suspicion and deceit.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: Traveling Saleswoman
programme.desc: A soapmaker's daughter (Joan Davis) goes to the Wild West, followed by her boyfriend (Andy Devine).

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge
programme.desc: A crack Nazi unit holds off the Allies during World War II.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: Judy Garland's 1944 musical dramatizes turn-of-the-century family life.

programme.title: Weekend at the Waldorf
programme.desc: The lives of guests and staff intertwine at a hotel over one weekend.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: After an accident, a literary critic recovers at the home of the family he was visiting, but his unplanned stay turns their lives upside down.

programme.title: Room for One More
programme.desc: A couple raising three kids brings two orphaned children into their home.

programme.title: Boys Town
programme.desc: True story of Father Flanagan's fight to build a home for orphaned boys.

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: A reformed rustler tracks down a band of cattle thieves.

programme.title: The Thin Man
programme.desc: Nick, Nora and their terrier somehow always seem to crack their case.

programme.title: Three Godfathers
programme.desc: Fugitives risk their lives to bring a baby out of the desert to safety.

programme.title: Doctor X
programme.desc: A reporter investigates a series of cannibalistic murders at a college.

programme.title: She
programme.desc: Explorers uncover a lost kingdom ruled by an immortal queen.

programme.title: The Human Comedy
programme.desc: A small-town telegraph boy deals with growing up during World War II.

programme.title: Bundle of Joy
programme.desc: A shop girl is mistaken for the mother of a foundling.

programme.title: Tortilla Flat
programme.desc: Inhabitants of a California village strive for the simple pleasures.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When the team goes to Morgan's old neighborhood to track an UnSub targeting middle-aged men, Morgan suspects they are looking for someone connected to the man who abused him as a child.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A 25-year-old time capsule opened in a small Colorado town reveals a gruesome discovery and a possible connection to a local police officer's death.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team heads to Rapid City when two men are murdered in a ritualistic way; Reid mourns Maeve's death.

programme.desc: The BAU team heads to Los Angeles in search of a suspect who kidnaps nannies and the children they care for.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When the Replicator returns, a member of the BAU team is targeted.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team tracks an increasingly devolving killer to Arizona; the team suspects Hotch is in the running to be the unit chief.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: As the hunt for a ritualistic killer continues, a bizarre familial connection could help the team zero in on the suspect.

programme.desc: The BAU team meets the new section chief (Esai Morales), who shares a long history with J.J.; an unknown subject leaves victims unable to communicate.

programme.desc: A priest is shot to death in his church rectory; Horatio and Delko examine the charred remain of a pregnant woman.

programme.desc: Booth and Brennan go under cover to find out what happened to a man whose remains were found lodged in the pinsetter at a bowling lane.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby gets to relive his former days of sporting glory when a death at the local Rugby Club sends Barnaby and Winter into a muddle of rucks, old grudges, new romances… and artisanal chocolates?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is less than impressed when Sarah drags him to a family friend’s wedding. But things soon go from bad to worse when tragedy strikes and Barnaby is called into action to catch a murderer with an apparent penchant for local brides.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferrabees Circus comes to town, bringing with it a chain of sinister clown sightings, threatening notes and deathly dangerous circus acts. Barnaby will have to face up to his fears in order to solve the case

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After a local photographer wins an urban myth competition with his creation of The Wolf Hunter, it unexpectedly gains a cult following. However, when a man is killed, Barnaby and Winter must investigate if this myth has become murderous reality.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local outcast, who was controversially acquitted of murder years earlier, is the latest inductee into a post-operative heart rehab club. Following his arrival, members' dreams of a second chance at life begin to be cut short.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. The police's detective skills are put to the test as they are forced to solve this case on their own.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Midsomer Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations; the investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Mummers, an amateur operatic society, rehearses for its charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in the theatre; the investigation quickly becomes a race to discover who is desperate to take centre stage.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Each year, the village of Angel's Rise hosts the Psychic Fayre. Founded by the Saint-Stephens family in memory of their late daughter, the event attracts mediums, psychics and followers of the occult. When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of the festival, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The unveiling of a newly-discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime-writer George Summersbee at the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new dad Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Lucille Ball: We Love Lucy

programme.title: Elizabeth Montgomery: A Bewitched Life
programme.desc: Among the most enduring TV sitcoms of all time, Bewitched remains beloved nearly sixty years after its debut. The series lead, Elizabeth Montgomery, was a complex, strong-willed woman whose life and career became an ongoing quest for love and recognition she never received from her movie star father. Bewitched became one of television's biggest hits during the turbulent 1960s, a time that was symbolic of the series' behind-the-scenes turmoil.

programme.desc: The reign of attorney and Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling comes crashing down after a racist rant, and he is banned from the NBA.

programme.title: Siegfried & Roy: The Original Tiger Kings
programme.desc: At the height of their fame, groundbreaking magicians Siegfried & Roy were the highest-paid entertainers in Las Vegas history, globally renowned for blending magic with their astonishing killer-cat interactions. Millions of tickets were sold, billions of dollars were made, and tiger mania swept the nation. But life in the ultra-exotic world of Siegfried & Roy may not have always been what it seemed, as the magicians lived by the art of illusion off stage as well-painstakingly crafting myths about their relationships with their tigers and even with each other. Then after building that empire based on smoke, mirrors and giant cats, Siegfried & Roy's longstanding world of illusions was destroyed by one fateful onstage encounter with an angry tiger in front of a sold-out audience. That horrifying act of violence shocked the world, unleashed a torrent of wild conspiracy theories, and forever redefined the magicians' legacy.

programme.title: John Wayne: Cowboys & Demons
programme.desc: John Wayne was an actor, a legend, and an embodiment of America itself; he also spent much of his life quietly tormented, desperately trying to measure up to the towering Hollywood persona he had crafted.

programme.title: Clint Eastwood: Hollywood Outlaw
programme.desc: Film clips and interviews with biographers and colleagues chart the prolific, six-decade career of maverick actor-director Clint Eastwood.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, Rygaard goes deep into their roughest terrain yet in an attempt to recapture the title; in Alaska, Papac's dreams of a repeat are shattered when Coatsy's badly injured; in Canada, a new candidate steps into the ring.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby and his new hand hit pay dirt with one of the biggest logs of the season; Coatsy's misstep in the yarder puts the crew in danger; the Dreadknots reunite and take the fight directly to Chapman's home turf.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, the crew nearly topples the yarder; a drastic toothache remedy; Chapman races a storm in Florida.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, Papac initiates an extremely dangerous process called Shotgun Logging; in Wyoming, the Zitterkopf men take the Bear Ranch site by storm; at Rygaard, the team doubles the yarders to increase production.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby uses an airboat to search for century-old logs; Rygaard attempts to move a six-ton cypress; David's sons hold down the fort while he delivers a load of logs to the mill; the Dreadknots suffer a late-day accident.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Louisiana, Shelby and his assistant Bob go out looking for logs on his repaired swamp buggy; In Central Florida, the Chapman crew goes to fight against the legendary Gump log.

programme.title: Ax Men
